parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: A primary verb; to convince; by analogy, to pacify or conciliate; reflexively or passively, to assent, to rely.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular

str2: Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To remain, abide, stay, wait; with acc: I wait for, await. A primary verb; to stay.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To remain by, abide with; met: I persevere in. From para and meno; to stay near, i.e. Remain.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Progress, advancement. From prokopto; progress, i.e. Advancement.
Joy, gladness, a source of joy. From chairo; cheerfulness, i.e. Calm delight.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
